verses.verse: 'Now if<WH3588> a person<WH5315> sins,<WH2398> after he hears<WH8085> a public<WH6963> adjuration<WH423> [to testify], when he is a witness,<WH5707> whether<WH176> he has seen<WH7200> or<WH176> [otherwise] known,<WH3045> if<WH518> he does not tell<WH5046> [it], then he will bear<WH5375> his guilt.<WH5771>

'Or<WH176> if<WH834> a person<WH5315> touches<WH5060> any<WH3605> unclean<WH2931> thing,<WH1697> whether<WH176> a carcass<WH5038> of an unclean<WH2931> beast,<WH9130> or<WH176> the carcass<WH5038> of unclean<WH2931> cattle,<WH929> or<WH176> a carcass<WH5038> of unclean<WH2931> swarming<WH8318> things,<WH8318> though it is hidden<WH5956> from him, and he is unclean,<WH2931> then he will be guilty.<WH816>

'Or<WH176> if<WH3588> he touches<WH5060> human<WH120> uncleanness,<WH2932> of whatever<WH3605> [sort] his uncleanness<WH2932> [may] be with which<WH834> he becomes<WH2930> unclean,<WH2930> and it is hidden<WH5956> from him, and then he comes to know<WH3045> [it], he will be guilty.<WH816>

'Or<WH176> if<WH3588> a person<WH5315> swears<WH7650> thoughtlessly<WH981> with his lips<WH8193> to do<WH7489> evil<WH7489> or<WH176> to do<WH3190> good,<WH3190> in whatever<WH3605> <WH834> matter a man<WH120> may speak<WH981> thoughtlessly<WH981> with an oath,<WH7621> and it is hidden<WH5956> from him, and then he comes to know<WH3045> [it], he will be guilty<WH816> in one<WH259> of these.<WH428>
'So it shall be when<WH3588> he becomes<WH816> guilty<WH816> in one<WH259> of these,<WH428> that he shall confess<WH3034> that in which<WH834> he has sinned.<WH2398>

'He shall also bring<WH935> his guilt<WH817> offering<WH817> to the Lord<WH3068> for his sin<WH9128> which<WH834> he has committed,<WH2398> a female<WH5347> from the flock,<WH6629> a lamb<WH3776> or<WH176> a goat<WH8166> <WH5795> as a sin<WH9128> offering.<WH9128> So the priest<WH3548> shall make<WH3722> atonement<WH3722> on his behalf<WH5921> for his sin.<WH9128>

'But if<WH518> he cannot<WH3808> afford<WH5060> <WH3027> a lamb,<WH7716> then he shall bring<WH935> to the Lord<WH3068> his guilt<WH817> offering<WH817> for that in which<WH834> he has sinned,<WH2398> two<WH8147> turtledoves<WH8449> or<WH176> two<WH8147> young<WH1121> pigeons,<WH3123> one<WH259> for a sin<WH9128> offering<WH9128> and the other<WH259> for a burnt<WH5930> offering.<WH5930>

'And he shall bring<WH935> them to the priest,<WH3548> who shall offer<WH7126> first<WH7223> that which<WH834> is for the sin<WH9128> offering<WH9128> and shall nip<WH4454> its head<WH7218> at the front<WH4136> of its neck,<WH6203> but he shall not sever<WH914> [it.]

'He shall also sprinkle<WH5137> some<WH4480> of the blood<WH1818> of the sin<WH9128> offering<WH9128> on the side<WH7023> of the altar,<WH4196> while the rest<WH7604> of the blood<WH1818> shall be drained<WH4680> out at the base<WH3247> of the altar:<WH4196> it is a sin<WH9128> offering.<WH9128>

'The second<WH8145> he shall then prepare<WH6213> as a burnt<WH5930> offering<WH5930> according to the ordinance.<WH4941> So the priest<WH3548> shall make<WH3722> atonement<WH3722> on his behalf<WH5921> for his sin<WH9128> which<WH834> he has committed,<WH2398> and it shall be forgiven<WH5545> him.

'But if<WH518> his means<WH3027> are insufficient<WH5381> for two<WH8147> turtledoves<WH8449> or<WH176> two<WH8147> young<WH1121> pigeons,<WH3123> then for his offering<WH7133> for that which<WH834> he has sinned,<WH2398> he shall bring<WH935> the tenth<WH6224> of an ephah<WH374> of fine<WH5560> flour<WH5560> for a sin<WH9128> offering;<WH9128> he shall not put<WH7760> oil<WH8081> on it or place<WH5414> incense<WH3828> on it, for it is a sin<WH9128> offering.<WH9128>

'And he shall bring<WH935> it to the priest,<WH3548> and the priest<WH3548> shall take<WH7061> his handful<WH4393> <WH7062> of it as its memorial<WH234> portion<WH234> and offer<WH6999> [it] up in smoke<WH6999> on the altar,<WH4196> with the offerings<WH801> of the Lord<WH3068> by fire:<WH801> it is a sin<WH9128> offering.<WH9128>

'So the priest<WH3548> shall make<WH3722> atonement<WH3722> for him concerning<WH5921> his sin<WH9128> which<WH834> he has committed<WH2398> from one<WH259> of these,<WH428> and it shall be forgiven<WH5545> him; then [the rest] shall become<WH1961> the priest's, like the grain offering.<WH4503>' "
Then the Lord<WH3068> spoke<WH1696> to Moses,<WH4872> saying,<WH559>

"If<WH3588> a person<WH5315> acts<WH4603> unfaithfully<WH4604> and sins<WH2398> unintentionally<WH7684> against<WH4480> the Lord<WH3068>'s holy<WH6944> things,<WH6944> then he shall bring<WH935> his guilt<WH817> offering<WH817> to the Lord: a ram<WH352> without<WH8549> defect<WH8549> from the flock,<WH6629> according to your valuation<WH6187> in silver<WH3701> by shekels,<WH8255> in [terms of] the shekel<WH8255> of the sanctuary,<WH6944> for a guilt<WH817> offering.<WH817>

"And he shall make<WH9608> restitution<WH9608> for that which<WH834> he has sinned<WH2398> against<WH4480> the holy<WH6944> thing,<WH6944> and shall add<WH3254> to it a fifth<WH2549> part<WH2549> of it, and give<WH5414> it to the priest.<WH3548> The priest<WH3548> shall then make<WH3722> atonement<WH3722> for him with the ram<WH352> of the guilt<WH817> offering,<WH817> and it shall be forgiven<WH5545> him.

"Now if<WH518> a person<WH5315> sins<WH2398> and does<WH6213> any<WH259> of the things which<WH834> the Lord<WH3068> has commanded<WH4687> not to be done,<WH6213> though he was unaware,<WH3045> <WH3808> still he is guilty,<WH816> and shall bear<WH5375> his punishment.<WH5771>

"He is then to bring<WH935> to the priest<WH3548> a ram<WH352> without<WH8549> defect<WH8549> from the flock,<WH6629> according to your valuation,<WH6187> for a guilt<WH817> offering.<WH817> So the priest<WH3548> shall make<WH3722> atonement<WH3722> for him concerning<WH5921> his error<WH7684> in which<WH834> he sinned<WH7683> unintentionally<WH7684> and did not know<WH3045> [it], and it shall be forgiven<WH5545> him.
"It is a guilt<WH817> offering;<WH817> he was certainly<WH816> guilty<WH816> before the Lord.<WH3068>"
